intro: Pluchea bifrons, commonly known as the slenderleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small blue to purple flowers bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Pluchea bifrons is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including fields and along roadsides.
